Hillary Clinton Kritik Keras Mark Zuckerberg
03 Nov 2019, 09:20 by Fino Yurio Kristo - detikInet


Hillary Clinton. Foto: REUTERS/Chris Aluka Berry

Jakarta - Mantan Menteri Luar Negeri Amerika Serikat, Hillary Clinton, mengecam Facebook dan pendirinya, Mark Zuckerberg. Dia menyebut Facebook merusak demokrasi dengan banyaknya informasi tidak benar beredar di sana.Dikutip detikINET dari Yahoo News, mantan lawan Donald Trump dalam Pilpres 2016 itu meminta Zuck segera bertindak untuk melawan iklan politik palsu yang lalu lalang di Facebook."Mark Zuckerberg harus membayar harga untuk apa yang dia lakukan pada demokrasi kita. Masalah dari kita, yang terganggu dengan perang antara kebenaran dan berita palsu ini adalah kita tidak cukup bagus melawannya," cetus Hillary."Berat karena kalian melawan algoritma, ditambah lagi semua kekuatan powerful itu, jadi sungguh berat," paparnya.Zuck belum lama ini mengatakan tidak akan melarang iklan politik di Facebook meski banyak protes seperti yang diutarakan Hillary. Adapun Twitter telah memutuskan melarangnya, kebijakan yang dipuji Hillary."Kami membuat keputusan untuk setop semua iklan politik secara global. Kami yakin jangkauan pesan politis harus dicapai sendiri, bukan dibeli," kata CEO Twitter, Jack Dorsey.Berbeda dengan Twitter, Facebook justru memutuskan lanjut menerima iklan politik. "Dalam sebuah demokrasi, saya pikir tidak tepat bagi perusahaan swasta untuk menyensor politisi atau beritanya," kata Zuck.

Hillary Clinton Strong criticism of Mark Zuckerberg
03 Nov 2019, 09:20 by Fino Yurio Kristo - detikInet


Hillary Clinton. Photo: REUTERS / Chris Aluka Berry

Jakarta - Former US Secretary of State Hillary Clinton criticized Facebook and its founder, Mark Zuckerberg. He called Facebook to undermine democracy with a lot of untrue information circulating there. Quoted from Yahoo News, the former opponent of Donald Trump in the 2016 presidential election asked Zuck to immediately act to counter false political advertisements passing on Facebook. "Mark Zuckerberg must pay the price for "What he did to our democracy. The problem with us, who are disturbed by the war between truth and false news, is that we are not good enough to fight it," Hillary said. "It's hard because you are against the algorithm, plus all those powerful forces, so it's really hard. , "he explained. Zuck recently said he would not ban political advertising on Facebook despite many protests as expressed by Hillary. Twitter has decided to ban it, a policy praised by Hillary. "We made the decision to stop all political advertisements globally. We believe the reach of political messages must be achieved alone, not bought," Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey said. Unlike Twitter, Facebook actually decided further accept political advertisements. "In a democracy, I don't think it's right for private companies to censor politicians or their news," Zuck said.
